_prev_prog_3.Description: SuperValu's implementation of its PSM program includes employee education in the hazards of ammonia and measures that can be used to reduce employee and community exposure to accidental ammonia releases. The plan includes a regular preventative maintenance program (Mechanical Integrity) for the ammonia refigeration system components, and a program for both pre-startup safety reviews and management of chnage (MOC) to the ammonia refrigeration system. The program also includes operating procedures for the safe operation of the refrigeration system, specific requiremenst for safe work practices (such as safe appraoches to welding and similar hot work), and safety requiremenst for contractors who may be hired to work on the refrigeration system. SuperValu has a procedure in place for investigating incidents to ensure root causes are identified and corrective actions are taken to minimize the potential for recurrence of incidents. The program also has a procedure for conducting compliance audits to ensure the PSM program is being implemented at the Mechanicsville Facility. Lastly the PSM written program incorporates the facilities emergency response plan and places special emphasis on handling accidental releases of ammonia and coordination of emergency response activities with the local fire department and other emergency response organizations.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The SuperValu, Inc. Mechanicsville, Virginia facility has a Risk Management Program (RMP) which complies with the requirements of Title 40 Code of Federal Regulations (CFR) part 68. The facility is also complying with OSHA's Process Safety Management Standard (PSM), Title 29 CFR 1910.119. The SuperValu, Inc. Mechanicsville PSM/RM Program, along with other company safety and training programs, deals with the risks involved in the storage, handling, and processes utilizing hazardous chemicals. In this way, SuperValu promotes overall plant, worker, and public safety. These programs enable our facility to prevent the occurrence, and minimize the consequences, of significant releases of toxic substances as well as fires, explosions, and other types of catastrophic accidents. Overall, these programs prevent accidental fatalities, injuries and illnesses, and avoid physical property and environmental damage.

The SuperValu Mechanicsville safety programs are applied to any activity involving hazardous chemicals including any use, storage, handling, or the on-site movement of such chemicals, or combination of these activities. Any group of vessels which are interconnected and separate vessels which are located such that a hazardous chemical could be involved in a potential release is considered a single process. 

The SuperValu Mechanicsville safety programs prevent accidents because they focus on the rules, procedures, and practices which govern individual processes, activities, or pieces of equipment. These rules are detailed and improved as necessary. They are also communicated to and accepted by all employees at the facility. 

The process covered by the SuperValu, Mechanicsville, Virginia PSM/RM Program is the ammonia refrigeration system. The ammonia refrigeration system provides cooling for the refrigerated storage of perishable food products. The refrigeration process involves a typical vapor compression refrigeration cycle with compressors, condenser, and evaporators

. The system is closed and is designed to completely contain the ammonia refrigerant within vessels, equipment, and piping specifically constructed for ammonia refrigeration.  Liquid ammonia is circulated from the vessels in the refrigeration equipment room to the evaporator coils which cool the refrigerated spaces by boiling off some of the ammonia liquid to vapor. The ammonia then returns to the equipment room where the ammonia vapor enters the compressors and is discharged at higher pressure to the condenser. The vapor is cooled in the condenser causing the vapor to condense a to liquid which is drained to the receiver vessel to repeat the refrigeration cycle. 

A worst case scenario and alternative release scenario have been calculated for this facility and are included with the main body of the submittal.

In addition to the implementation of safety programs in compliance with the OSHA PSM Standard and the EPA RMP Program regulations the SuperValu, Inc. Mechanicsville, Virginia ammonia refrigeration system has been designed and constructed in accordance with applicable codes and standards including ANSI/IIAR 2-1992 (Standard for Equipment, Design and Installation of Ammonia Mechanical Refrigerating Systems). Standard operating procedures and training programs have been developed for the facility personnel to specifically address the characteristics of the SuperValu Mechanicsville refrigeration system. 

The SuperValu Mechanicsville facility's emergency response program is based on OSHA requirements for Emergency Action Plans (29 CFR 1910.38 and 1910.119) and HAZWOPER (29 CFR 1910.120). We have trained employees for emergency response and maintain a written emergency response plan. This plan is coordinated with the Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC) and the local fire department. We conduct annual drills for implementation of the emergency response plan at the facility with the participation of the LEP and the fire department.

le facility has a management system in place which has been developed to assure that the PSM/RMP Program is implemented, documented, and updated to assure its effectiveness.
